preqs: One of BCH2011, BCH2022, MOL2011, MOL2022, MCB2011, MCB2022 or BMS2021 or BMS2062

rules.ruleString: (Must have passed an (I/W) unit in {BCH2011, BCH2022, MCB2011, MCB2022, MOL2011, MOL2022} OR  Must have passed an (I/W) unit in {BMS2021, BMS2062})
(Must have passed an (I/W) unit in {BCH2011, BCH2022, MOL2011, MOL2022} OR Must have passed an (I/W) unit in {BMS2021, BMS2062})

unitName: Protein biology: From sequence to structure and disease
description: The course will give students an advanced understanding of protein structure-function in the context of human disease. Major themes relate the various levels of protein structure to their wide ranging functions, introduce modern techniques used in the analysis of structure and function, and explore the rapidly developing area of protein-related biotechnologies and drug design. Topics to be covered include examples of aberrations in protein structure that lead to alteration in function in a variety of biological contexts, emphasizing disease.  Additionally the use of bioinformatics in aiding our understanding of protein sequence, structure and function will be highlighted.
